name: Easy Vegan Strawberry Sauce
description: A simple and delicious vegan strawberry sauce made with frozen organic strawberries, perfect for topping desserts, breakfast, and more.

dry.name: granulated sugar
dry.notes: You can adjust to your desired sweetness.

instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water to create a slurry. Set aside.
In a medium saucepan, combine the frozen strawberries and sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the strawberries start to break down and release their juices (about 5-7 minutes).
Stir in the lemon juice and vanilla extract.
Pour the cornstarch slurry into the saucepan and whisk to combine.
Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. The sauce will continue to thicken as it cools.
For a smoother sauce, you can use an immersion blender or transfer it to a regular blender.
notes: This sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. It's excellent on pancakes, waffles, ice cream, or yogurt.
